utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you guys!

utterance.speaker: Ross and Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you kidding? Okay, I’ll give you a hint; I’ll give you a hint.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Eyes! No, no. Your eyes! No. Chandler’s eyes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I got glasses!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, you-you’ve always had glasses.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No I didn’t!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, did-didn’t you use to have a pair? They were really round, burgundy, and they made you look kind of umm…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Feminine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sweetie, I think the glasses look great. They make you look really sexy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You didn’t think I used to wear glasses, right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Of course!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So what do you guys want for an engagement present?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s okay Pheebs, we’re not having a party or anything, so you don’t have to get us…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: If someone wants to give us a present, we don’t want to deprive them of that joy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, y’know what you should get ‘em? One of those little uh, portable CD players.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I already have one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Not unless someone borrowed it and left it at the gynecologist.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, and-and-and by someone, she means Joey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, I know I what I want!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What we want honey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, you don’t want this. I want to have your grandmother’s cookie recipe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You mean the chocolate chip cookie recipe?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You mean the one that my grandmother made me swear on her deathbed that I would never let out of our family?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dying people say the craziest things.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I wanted it for years! I was gonna make cookies for my children.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Break my heart—Oh, all right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. I’m gonna be the mom that makes the world’s best chocolate chip cookies.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Our kids are gonna be fat aren’t they.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahoy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! How’s the boat?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great! I’m finally getting into this sailing stuff.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, so you finally took it out of the marina huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why would I do that? It took three guys to get the thing in there!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: If you don’t sail your boat, what do you do on it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, it’s great! It’s a great place to just kinda, sit, hang around, drink a few beers, eat some chips.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it’s good that you finally have a place to do that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know Joey, I could teach you to sail if you want.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You could?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! I’ve been sailing my whole life. When I was fifteen my dad bought me my own boat.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Your own boat?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! What?! He was trying to cheer me up! My pony was sick.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you know what I was thinkin’?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nothing, I just like to go like this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Chandler, what are you doing tonight?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh why, do you have a lecture?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, why?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Then free as a bird. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My dad wanted to know if you wanted to play racquetball with us.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! That’s great! Dad must really like you, he doesn’t ask just anyone to play.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah and he didn’t really ask for you, he asked for Chancy, I assumed he meant you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, did-did you correct him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I-I thought it would be more fun this way.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is so cool, maybe this is something you can do every week.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Or you can sit with him on the front porch and make sure no one steals the trash cans. He does that every week too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He hates to lose.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no problem, maybe I’ll play with my left hand.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re not a lefty?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Does anybody know me?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What’s wrong Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just went to my old apartment to get you the-the cookie recipe and the stupid fire burned it up!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No!! Why didn’t you make a copy and-and keep it in a fireproof box and keep it at least a hundred yards from the original?!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because I’m normal! That was the one legacy my grandmother left me, and I know you wanted it as an engagement present.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, we have to get you an engagement present?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No one got me an engagement present.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, here I wish you health and happiness.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: An old cookie?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is what happens when you don’t register for gifts!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: See no-no, I made a batch and I froze it, and this is the only one left.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We can’t accept this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ‘Cause it’s gross.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! Wait! I think I can figure out the recipe from this cookie! I do stuff like this at work all the time.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! I bet I can do it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, we owe you a present.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Two! I’ve been engaged twice!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look at this clown! Just because he’s got a bigger boat he thinks he can take up the whole river. Get out of the way jackass! Who names his boat Coast Guard anyway?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That is the Coast Guard.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are they doing out here? The coast’s all the way over there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, just ignore the boats all right? We’re not finished with the lesson yet.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, I’m just gonna go over the basic points just one more time, are you ready?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on Rach, not again. I got it! Okay? Let’s start sailing, and I want to go over there where that boatload of girls is! Yo-ho-ho!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Is that what you want to do? You wanna go over and give a little shout out to the old, hot chickas? Okay, let’s do that Sailor Joe. Quick question though, what’s this called?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, boat rope.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wrong! How do you get the mainsail up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uhh, rub it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. What do you do if I say we are coming about?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’d say, come again. No-no, wait I-I-I know this one, I know this one, uh…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Time’s up, now your dead.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And deaf!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you just go on and make your little jokey-jokes, but if you do not know what you are doing out at sea you will die at sea. Am I getting through to you sailor?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Don’t just say yes! This isn’t a game, Joey you can really get hurt out here. Okay, so do you want to pay attention or do you want to die?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I want to make a ship to shore call to Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, I definitely taste nutmeg.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You don’t? Well, that’s the difference between a professional and a layman.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That and arrogance.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! How was sailing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t want to talk about it. Y’know, you could’ve at least saved me a whole cookie.

utterance.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
utterance.content: No-wait-no-no!!!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Women are mean!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t believe that! Now the only thing left of my grandmother’s legacy is this crumb. I wish you a long and happy marriage.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! How was it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I had a great time! Umm, Chancy on the other hand…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I will tell the story! It was going great. I let him win. We were bonding. He even said I could call him dad.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And what did he ask you not to call him?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Daddy. All right look, here’s the story. Well, we had just finished playing racquetball and we were gonna take a steam. I walk into the steam room and it was really steamy. So I take off my glasses and that’s when in happened.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Guys?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Over here.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Have a seat son. Hey!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God Chandler! I can’t believe it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You gave my father a lap dance!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why do they put so much steam in there?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ‘Cause otherwise they’d have to call it the room room.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why? Okay? Why? Wh-wh-why did that have to happen?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on, it’s not that big a deal!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Not that big a deal? There…there was touching of things.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now, I know you wanted to bond with my dad, but did you really have to bond to that part?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Listen, I’m sure that dad doesn’t care. He probably thought this was funny; he’ll be telling this story for years!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t want him to tell this story for years.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, but he will. He still tells the story how Monica tried to escape from fat camp.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I wasn’t escaping.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Then how did you get caught in the barbed wire?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I was trying to help out a squirrel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You were trying to eat it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If that is your father calling to tell this story then the marriage is off!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on. Hello? I’m sorry you have the wrong number. Okay, I’ll call you later dad. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, I’m off to see your dad.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa, aren’t you a little over dressed?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, and-and you better make sure he tips you this time.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I figured I would try to convince him not to tell the story anymore, and I figure the best way to do that is face to face—And by face I don’t mean his lap. And by face, I don’t mean my ass.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey are you getting Monica and Chandler an engagement present?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know. Y’know, they didn’t get us anything.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well hello! So, when are we gettin’ back out on the water matey?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh uh, I don’t know the boat way to say this, but uh never!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Because! You’re mean on the boat!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? I was just trying to teach you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, lesson learned! Rachel is mean!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeeeeeep… Yep-yep-yep-yep-yep. I remember when she took out on her dad’s boat she wouldn’t let me help at all.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Excuse me, I wanted you to help, but you couldn’t move your arms because you were wearing three life jackets.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You have to respect the sea!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look Joey, I’m sorry if-if you thought that was mean, but I gotta tell ya something. That was not mean. Okay, my father is mean. He used to yell at me all the time on the boat, I mean it was horrible. I was just being a good teacher.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Does a good teacher say, "Put down the beer pinhead!?"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, does a good student drink seven beers during his first lesson?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Six and a half! You knocked that last one out of my hand! Remember?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I didn’t want you to get hit by the boom!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well it hit me anyway! And it would’ve hurt a lot less if I had finished that last beer.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, y’know what? I-I’m sorry. I will try to tone it down and uh stop yelling.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You won’t boss me around anymore?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I won’t boss you around.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And you’ll be nice?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And, I’ll be nice.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And you’ll be topless?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And—Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you want me to learn?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, here’s batch 22. Ohh, maybe these’ll taste a little like your grandmother’s. This has a little bit of orange peel, but no nutmeg.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Let’s give it a shot.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Man, I have not made this many cookies since I was in the ninth grade.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, what was that for? Like a bake sale?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, just a Friday night.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohh, these are pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but not as good as batch 17.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Which one was that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The ones we had right after you almost threw up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Batch 17 was good. I did not like batch 16. I’m okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are there anymore from the good batch? ‘Cause we could just work off of those.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, ooh yeah, I think there is one from batch 17 left, uh… It’s batch 16! 16 people! Get out of the way!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay Joey honey, you’re doing really good! All right, now I’m just gonna need you to step to the port side. Remember? Remember how we talked about the port side?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s left sweetie, but that’s okay sweetie, that’s a tough one.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know why you just don’t say left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, go to the left. The left!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Just sit over there!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay! Okay, you’re yelling again! See that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No-no, no-no-no, very quiet, said with love, no yelling.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, y’know what? Since I’m here, I think I’m gonna have me a little beer on the port side.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay Joey, we’re luffing a little bit, so could you tighten up the cunningham?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, wow, you just said a bunch of stuff I didn’t know there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, come on! We just went over this!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, y’know, when we did that was when that bird was flying overhead with the fish in his mouth. Did you see it? It was gross!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! All right?! I did not see the bird! I did not see the fish! I did not see the piece of Styrofoam that was shaped like Mike Tyson! I did not, because I was trying to teach you how to sail a boat! Which obviously is an impossible thing to do!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right that’s it! You’re yelling and I don’t see you taking your top off! I quit!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What do you mean you quit?! You can’t quit!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why not?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because you’re not finished yet and I won’t have it! Greens do not quit!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Greens? I’m a Tribbiani! And Tribbianis quit!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God, wait did I—I just said Greens don’t quit didn’t I? Did I just say Greens don’t quit?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes! Yes! You did and you’re still yelling at me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No! No! I’m not yelling at you, I’m just yelling near you. Oh God Joey, ohh I’m my father. Oh my God, this is horrible! I’ve been trying so hard not to be my mother I did not see this comin’. Oh, Joey, I’m sorry. I’m so sorry. I just wanted you to learn.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, hey I did learn.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Come on.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Awww…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s okay. I know what a mainsail is. I know, I know to duck when the boom comes across. I-I know port is right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Left.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Damnit!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know, I bet it would actually make my grandmother very happy to know that we’re trying to figure out her recipe. I bet she’s l-l-lookin’ up at us and smiling right now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Looking up?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah—No, she was really nice to me, but she’s in hell for sure.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I’ve tried everything. I give up. I guess I’m not gonna be the mom who makes the world’s best chocolate cookies. I do make the best duck confit with broccoli rabe. Kids love that right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aww, Pheeb, come on isn’t there any relative that would have the recipe? What about, what about your sister?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no-no, no, I made a promise to myself that the next time I would talk to Ursula would be over my dead body. And that’s not happening ‘til October 15th, 2032.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s the day you’re gonna die? See—darnit, I’ve got shuffleboard that day.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s what you think.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I mean what about friends of your grandmother’s? Wouldn’t they have the recipe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, y’know I may have relatives in France who would know. My grandmother said she got the recipe from her grandmother, Nesele Tolouse.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What was her name?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nesele Toulouse.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nestle Tollhouse?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, you Americans always butcher the French language.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, is this the recipe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes!! Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I cannot believe that I just spent the last two days trying to figure out the recipe and it was in my cupboard the whole time!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know! You see it is stuff like this which is why you’re burning in hell!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So you understand, I’d feel a lot more comfortable if you didn’t tell people what happened. Y’know, I’m a little…I’m a little embarrassed about it.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I understand completely, there’s nothing more horrifying than embarrassing yourself in front of your in-laws. As a matter of fact, when I started dating Judy I was unemployed, and her father asked me what I did for a living and I told him I was a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What did you do when they found out?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: They never did, so if ever see me giving them legal advice just nod along. Shall we?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So I guess we wear swimsuits in here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well Joey, I hate to admit it, your way of sailing is a lot more fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Hey, why don’t you give a pull on that rope?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh we’re not sailing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just pull on it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right. Hey-hey-hey!! Sandwiches!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What else?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What you—don’t hold it like that! You’re lettin’ all the good stuff fall out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh whoops.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Careful! You’re wasting good pastrami! Oh my God! I’m my dad!
